text: Transition Live Updates: House Approves Stopgap Funding Bill Hours Ahead of Shutdown Deadline  —  The new legislation would keep the government open but did not include the debt ceiling increase that President-elect Donald J. Trump had demanded.  It now goes to the Senate.  —  Here are the latest developments.

Live updates: Government shutdown disarray offers preview of Trump term battles  —  Just as the government funding deadline arrived early Saturday, Congress passed an interim plan to prevent a shutdown after a chaotic few days and nights in Washington.  —  President Biden is expected to sign the funding bill on Saturday.

House passes bill to avert government shutdown after whirlwind funding fight  —  The House approved legislation to avert a government shutdown hours before the deadline Friday, sending the bill to the Senate for consideration after a whirlwind week on Capitol Hill.

8 policies stripped from GOP bill after Trump, Musk rebellion  —  Research for children's health, a crackdown on junk fees, pay hikes for lawmakers and more were jettisoned from the legislation.  —  The House of Representatives approved legislation Friday to keep the government funded …

Trump's claims of a mandate run into reality of narrow majorities  —  Donald Trump's last-minute demands for a congressional funding package were rejected by Republicans, foreshadowing the challenges he could face next year.  —  President-elect Donald Trump's last-minute demands …

Outrage as Elon Musk claims ‘only AfD can save Germany’  —  German health minister calls US billionaire's intervention weeks before election ‘undignified and problematic’  —  Elon Musk has caused outrage in Berlin after appearing to endorse the far-right, anti-immigrant Alternative für Deutschland.

Senate approves bill to expand Social Security to millions of Americans  —  Legislation to expand Social Security benefits to millions of Americans passed the U.S. Senate early Saturday and is now headed to the desk of President Biden, who is expected to sign the measure into law.
